comment: The work is not hard at all, but her grading requirements are always changing. I have received several grades with notes that do not reflect the assignment I submitted and have gotten points docked for things that have been done the whole semester or told to do in the directions. Class is ESRI online course work with little written by the professor

This class was based solely on the book. You read from the book and took quizzes from the book. There is a lot of extra room for grades, meaning you don't have to make A's to have a final grade of an A at the end.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Online Savvy

comment: Dr. Pullen offers an average class that needs improvements. This class felt like she did not develop it herself and her grading shows. She docks points for things you have not learned about yet and does not explain them well: you won't understand them until you actually cover the module she is referencing. Prepare to be frustrated.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Took her in Spring 2022, she was alright for an online professor. Just had too many tests & labs that were a bit excessive for her class. All on Connect. She also never responded to my emails until the very end of the semester when I messaged her through D2L once & she finally messaged back (yikes). Overall, work heavy & just be cautious taking her

I can't say this professor is great but I did take it as an online class so it was relatively easy. She uses a point system so once you reach a certain amount of points you don't have to do anymore work (there are SO many points available to make an easy A). I would take her again if I could.

Dr. Pullen, although a somewhat nice person, has been the worst professor I have ever taken. DO NOT TAKE HER IF ABLE. Chose a different professor or a different elective if you can. She doesn't grade things until the week before finals (things still aren't graded!), and doesn't respond to emails. Please save yourself the stress of worrying! BEWARE.

Look at the date this was posted. The semester ends in less than a week. Yet, my grade book has only recently become populated, it was empty just a few days ago. While other classes have come to an end, major assignments are assigned in the final 2 weeks. Communication is a roll of the dice.

She is a nice professor however, she will not put grades in until the absolute last minute. Currently have 1 week until the semester is over and I dont even have a letter grade estimate as she has 1 small assignment graded out of 20. Don't even bother sending an email either, she does not read them. Super disorganized but tenured.

The class overall was an easy A but she’s very hard to contact. I emailed her multiple times throughout this semester and never got a response. Alot of work but all of it is due at the end of the month so you have time to complete. If you’re not looking to teach yourself I do not recommend this teacher.

This was the worst professor I've had. She doesn't respond to emails in a timely manner and assigns more homework than is probably necessary with no really teaching. I'm taking this again as a requirement. KSU is allowing her through which is bizarre.

She was the most difficult teacher Ive ever taken at KSU. Its not the content necessarily, but her lack of communication. Im glad some people were able to contact her, but I struggled to get a response back from her a majority of the emails I sent to her. If you can work fine on your own, shell work.

The class had plenty of video lectures on labs and reading to supplement the learning. The one lab that didn't have a video lecture was SUPER hard. No idea what others are talking about, Dr. Pullen has gotten back to me within a 24-hour period on most of the emails. Even bestowed data links for me to use for my project data!
She does not communicate. She wont respond to emails and she attacks students in replies. Shes a very difficult teacher to take.
Most of the links don't work, and she is super out of touch with the students. The emails she gives back take weeks to a month that is if the professor wants to reply. I wish I can say more.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Almost impossible to get in touch with her, accused me of cheating when I didn't as well as took points off discussion posts stating that I didn't provide an article link when I did (take pics of discussion posts cause they aren't visible after the due date) only good thing about the class is unlimited attempts on the labs (links are broken though)

If you're taking this online, yes, the class is easy once you get the hang of it, but if you're confused on anything about the course or your grades or anything, she will NOT reply. She emails back literal weeks after you ask a question, sometimes when it's no longer relevant, not to mention she's kinda rude in them too!

This was the easiest A of my career. Labs are unlimited attempts, and all of the homeworks are easy 100s. This class is so easy. The only hard thing about it was the quizzes. I failed the last 2 and still got an A in the class. Take this class for an easy GPA booster!!!

This class had the potential to be amazing... Only problem is that if you have a problem or a question, she can't be reached. She doesn't answer emails unless you contact the head of the department to complain. All assignments are fairly easy, the class is just confusing as you have to figure everything out on your own.

This class was set up to be great, modules were given with ample time and you can go at your own pace. Not difficult if you put the time in. Labs, but you get unlimited tries and it tells you what you get wrong. Heres the problem, she never replied to ANY emails. She has not graded ANY assignments, just the ones that are automatic go in. Beware.
four week summer class was a ton of work but worth it. basically a self graded system where you choose which assignments you want to do and they're all worth different amounts of points.

Dr. Pullen is invested in ensuring that students are successful inside and outside of class, with an emphasis on providing skills that are required in a business professional environment. Grades are based heavily on participation and discussion. I would recommend her to anyone wishing to prepare themselves for work in the GIS field.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Take this class online! Plenty of time given to do the lab which you get unlimited attempts for 100. Quiz can be found online. Learn smart is also easy.

One of the biggest parts of your grade is a participation assignment for every module which isn't hard but just takes time. Labs have unlimited attempts. Quizzes are a pretty difficult which is when reading will come in handy. Extra credit option for reviewing each lab. Not a very hard class, just very time consuming.

4 week summer class was difficult. Lots of reading. Unlimited attempts on labs and they are 40% of your grade. You will need unlimited attempts because they are extremely clunky and cumbersome...i.e. broken links, tabs that don't do anything, etc. The "important parts" in the learnsmart don't match up with what is on the tests.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I took this online as a 4-week summer course. The work load was really heavy and you should dedicate a lot of time to this class. Nonetheless, all answers can be found online. Also, there is an ample amount of opportunity for extra credit! This teacher is really strict when it comes to deadlines whether it's her fault or not, so be aware of that.

This class was beyond easy. Lab attempts are unlimited so you can do them until you get a 100 and you can find quizzes online. Lots of extra credit opportunity. Basically, just do the assignments and you'll get an A. She also opened up the last two sections early so we could finish the semester a couple weeks early.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT--Would take again

comment: Dr. Pullen made this class very easy. There are 9 labs, unlimited attempts, she takes the highest attempted score, so you can get 100% every time. Quiz for every chapter in connect, as well as learnsmart assignments. She provided A LOT of extra credit opportunities. I would definitely take her online classes again. *Never taken on campus with her.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--EXTRA CREDIT--Would take again

comment: I really do not like science, but this professor was easy to get a hold of, she was easy to understand, and she made all of her directions very easy to follow. You have simple online labs that you can take as many times as you want to receive a 100%. The quizzes are somewhat difficult if you don't study.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Would take again

comment: Do not take this class unless you absolutely have to. It is a ton of content and she teaches as if everyone already knows as much as she does. This is not a enjoyable course. Spare yourself the despair.

Dr. Pullen is a good professor! You can tell she really enjoys what she does and she cares about her students.  The class was very informative. If you study, read the chapters, review the interactive videos, and lab you should do fine. Many of the test and labs did have issues, however once reported to the professor were omitted and/or credited.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Class was only a 4 week course, so it was expected to be fast-paced. There were several issues with the quizzes and modules - incorrect answers, missing info, etc. The professor was pretty rude in her communication through email and on the discussion boards. Overall class was not terrible, and professor curved final grades at the end.
I just took this class in the summer, It was an easy class, but I had to use the book in order to do good. You cannot fail , you will get a good grade if you try. Good teacher.

This course was over all very easy as well as interesting and professor Pullen is not a bad choice to work with. There are 5 exams (including final), 10 labs (google earth- pay close attention to these as sometime the GE system can fudge up a bit) and thats it! Easy A if you read the chapters and do the work on time.

She is a great source of knowledge and highly skilled in her field. She is a very busy woman with many different responsibilities so take that into consideration when you communicate with her. She may not always seem to be on the ball but in fact, she is very precise and accurate, just very, very busy at all times. Wonderful professor and adviser.

Pullen is a pretty entertaining lecturer, especially considering the class is at night and 3 hours long (yuck). The course material can be challening, but it is a 3000 level class and it wouldn't be preparing GIS majors adequately if it wasn't. If you complete the labs on time and correctly, attend class, and study for the tests, you'll be fine.

One of the best classes I have taken. She is demanding, but fair. She will push you, but you will learn so much. She takes her time with you during office hours this shows she really cares and wants you to succeed. I wish there were more like her at KSU. I will definitely be taking more classes with her.

This class does require some work, but it is well worthwhile. Dr. NHP's lectures are fantastic to listen to, makes attending an evening class far better than it has any right to be. Tests aren't easy, but she grades fairly on them and the labs.

Very disrespectful, condescending, and rude.  She honestly feels you should dedicate 12 to 15 hours towards her courses, yet she doesn't seem to even spend a fraction of that time on the class.  Constantly late in grading, and don't even think about requesting some additional guidance. In short she's a great geographer and a horrible professor.

Took 4 week ONLINE summer course with Dr. Pullen and earned a B. We had 2 labs due (Tuesday and Thursday) and a test every Friday. The tests were straight from the book. Dr. Pullen's draw back is her inability to answer emails or discussion posts in a timely manner when this was a 4 week, 4 credit hour course. I would probably take her again.

I took her online class and it was alright at best. You do a lab every week and then take the online exam, about 60 questions for an hour and fifteen minutes so you can use your book. The labs mostly used Google Earth, and they could be kinda confusing sometimes, but overall not too terrible.

I loved this class. She played the bad cop of the 2 professors - and had good chemistry with the good cop professor. I learned so much, that I am changing my major to environmental studies so I can take more classes with her. Highly recommended.

Took an online class with her. Never answered emails of questions directed at her on the discussion board in a timely manner. Rude and disrespectful. Did not make sure her materials were up to date. The labs we did always had online links that were no longer functional. Quizzes from book gave incorrect answers.
Very scatterbrained. Manner of speech is difficult to follow. She will make a mistake in almost every powerpoint and/or quiz

late, unprepared, and no apparent interest in being a useful teacher.  all reading materials were online so no text required but gives open note final only, no quizes or other test.  not possible to determine your grade in that she is weeks late returning monthly writing assigments.  unless GEOG major, useless class with this teacher.

Brilliant geographer and cartographer. However, useless as a teacher. She always seem preoccupied with other things. Speaks in a mumble and in ambiguous terms. Kind of a fly by the seat of the pants professor.

smart lady, kinda cute, but has no desire to really be useful professor. She seems preoccupied with things other than her classes. Always late, with everything, and never prepared for class. But, she expects you to be on time for anything and everything or you get 1/2 off your grade. Don't quite understand that one.

This class was proably the most enjoyable one I have ever had. You go on a class fieldtrip and one group field trip. Her labs make this class super intersting.She knows what shes talking a bout. though she is always late for class.

always late. Smart lady but seriously needs to focus on being a professor. She doesn't take any whining or crap from students (which is a plus). Very disorganized. She may cause you to pull your hair out...

Mumbles and stumbles around so much, she is almost incomprehensible. Speaks in very short choppy sentences that start with a low pitch, and then gradually increases till the end. Then always followed by the word ?Right??. Very annoying. Crams way too much material in for one semester and requires usage of outdated and useless computer programs.

Funny, sarcastic, and seemingly has little patience for stupidity. She is always late, but it's not as huge a deal as everyone else claims. Very smart, and is a really fun teacher, though not always the clearest. Read the book, study your notes, you'll get an A; class doesn't require much more skill than memorization and a little simple math.

Flaky, flaky, flaky. Knows her stuff though. Loves trying to teach, but seems to present her instruction on a high school level. NEVER on time for class. NEVER so be prepared. Very nice lady, just could not hold my interest due to her lack of respect for students.
Great class.  Cute prof.  Sarcastic sense of humor that takes getting used to but is funny once you do.
Fun lady, and cute as a button!
Great teacher! She is really funny and kind of out there. She has a great sense of humor and makes class fun. Tests are pretty easy if you study or read the chapters.

I don?t get the "scatterbrained? comments as I found her to be intelligent with an awesome sense of humor.  If you want to learn something and wish to do so on a college level, Prof. Pullen?s classes are for you.  If you?re just ?buying? a diploma, then move on to someone else and leave both her and the serious learners alone.

Her class is in the top ten best I've had at KSU.  Tests are what should be expected of a college level course and her grading is extremely fair.  Besides, tests only cover items in class/labs so no there really should be no surprises if you study.  I don?t get the ?scatterbrained? comments as I found her to be intelligent with an awesome sense of

Very cool professor. Very interesting, funny. she is the most scatterbrained professor I've had. ALWAYS late for class. NEVER reminds you when tests are or the deadlines on projects so read the syllabus! Often said "I don't feel like lecturing", so read the book. LONG tests. Stiff late work policy (50% off automatically) Pretty easy class if you go

She is such an interesting professor. She has the greatest sense of humor and kinda lives in her own little world. The class is fairly easy if you attend class everyday and do all the labs. She offers alot of extra credit and curves the grade. If you want an easy A this is the class to take.
Shes great

While others that had her for 1101 seemingly had no problem, 1112 has been incredibly hard for a 1000-level course. It is a combined lab class, but the concepts are fairly complex. Four exams - three of which are six front/back pages or more - were not tricky, but they require more analysis than rote memorization. Take her if you want to learn.

If you show up for class, take the short map quizzes, and pay attention, you'll learn quite a bit.  I really enjoyed how she mixed in her experiences, guest speakers, You-Tube Clips, and great slides to keep the class fluid.
So pretty much if you're interested in a class that has a professor constantly saying, "Um... um, um... um", then this is the class for you! Very boring, but a pretty easy A.

You have to show up for class or risk losing bunches of points on in class assignments. That being said, everything is pretty easy. Just study mainly the notes(online) for the quizzes and the quizzes and notes for the midterm. I didn't study too much and only skipped twice and got a high A.
Tests were straight from the quizzes, quizzes straight from the book. Only reason to go to class is to take quizzes and do in class activities which she grades.
